item.title: Seamless Integration of Surface and Borehole Data
item.description:
Modern Approach to Seismic Data

We modeled ideal conditions for studying salt intrusions using DAS capabilities: simultaneous surface and borehole recording.

Surface seismic

  • ğŸ”¹ 2201 sources at 100m spacing
  • ğŸ”¹ Receivers (50m, Â±10km coverage)

Borehole measurements (DAS)

  • ğŸ”¹ Continuous fiber optics (100-5000m)
  • ğŸ”¹ 15m channel spacing

Joint Data Inversion

  • 2ï¸âƒ£ First-arrival tomography
  • 3ï¸âƒ£ Full Waveform Inversion (FWI)
  • 4ï¸âƒ£ Reverse Time Migration (RTM)

Solutions We Provide

item.title: Field Case Study: High-Frequency FWI on Viking Graben Line 12
item.description:
Key Study Highlights

We successfully applied 35Hz Full Waveform Inversion (FWI) and Least-Squares RTM to the benchmark Viking Graben Line 12 dataset - the North Sea’s classic test profile.

Acquisition Parameters

  • ğŸ”¹ Streamer length: 3 km
  • ğŸ”¹ Profile length: 28.75 km
  • ğŸ”¹ Model depth: 4 km
  • ğŸ”¹ 3 validation wells (Well 4, 5, 7)

Breakthrough Results with High-Frequency FWI

Enhanced Velocity Model Resolution

  • ğŸ”¹ Refractions improved shallow section (355-800m)
  • ğŸ”¹ Reflections sharpened fault imaging (LSRTM section)
  • ğŸ”¹ Achieved industry-leading 35Hz inversion frequency

Well Data Validation

item.title: Colada - Modular Platform for Geological and Geophysical Problem Solving
item.description:
Powerful Tool for Data Analysis, Visualization and Interpretation

Colada is a flexible and extensible platform designed for professionals in geology, geophysics and engineering. It combines high-performance computing (FWI/RTM) with modern virtual and augmented reality (VR/AR) technologies, providing complete control over data and processes.

Technological Foundation

  • ğŸ”¹ C++ core - maximum performance
  • ğŸ”¹ Full Python integration - all functionality accessible via Python scripts
  • ğŸ”¹ Cross-platform - works on Windows, Linux, macOS

Data Visualization

  • ğŸ”¹ 2D/3D graphics with VR/AR and holographic display support
  • ğŸ”¹ Data synchronization and projection for team collaboration
  • ğŸ”¹ 3D printing support - creation of physical geological structure models

Flexibility and Extensibility

  • ğŸ”¹ Modular architecture - add new features through C++ or Python
  • ğŸ”¹ Built-in Python interpreter - work directly or via Jupyter Notebook
  • ğŸ”¹ GUI designer - rapid interface creation without deep programming knowledge

Who is Colada For?

  • 1ï¸âƒ£ Geophysicists - pre/post-stack data visualization
  • 2ï¸âƒ£ Geologists - 3D reservoir model visualization and editing
  • 3ï¸âƒ£ Research teams - R&D solution prototyping and implementation
